European Commission presents draft negotiating mandates for EU-U.S. trade talks - part of the implementation of the July statement of Presidents Juncker and Trump. Press release with links to all documents: https://t.co/582ALxRo5b
Many German ministries have updated their websites with new information and Q&A. See how the German government prepares https://t.co/J2VAhIZBRX https://t.co/sJjQ23c4li

#EU27consultations. Honoured to address the Council of State, Pdt Marcelo Rebelo De Sousa, @antoniocostapm, the Parliament & social partners on Brexit in Lisbon today. For the UK to clarify its position. Time is almost up. https://t.co/QZodzHCdD1
@doberah Ha! (Imagine what happened when, as an Eng student new to Stuttgart in 1991, I failed to understand the VITAL significance of the Kehrwoche sign outside my flat)

German elevator etiquette remains a freakin' minefield. Just saw a passenger *lose it* when a small group that entered after him ON THE SAME FLOOR fail to say "Guten Tag". "NA, SCHOENEN TAG NOCH!!" he cried on exiting.
TRANSCRIPT: Read in full what @MichelBarnier and @TimmermansEU said in the @Europarl_EN this morning after the #MeaningfulVote in the #UK: https://t.co/H4MsNtnOsw https://t.co/SXnZFb5wO3

Commons vote did not express a majority for an alternative to the draft Withdrawal Agreement, the “best possible compromise” says @MichelBarnier in EP. UK must now clarify how to proceed towards orderly #Brexit & ambitious new partnership.

https://t.co/r8LKTipjeO

“The compromise reached after 18 months is the best compromise. It is the result of constructive work and attitude, which we will maintain until the end: calm, unity, dialogue and transparency. It is now for the UK to clarify how it wishes to proceed"
@MichelBarnier #Brexit https://t.co/VFEtEH9TKe

Massive, extended applause for Michel Barnier in European Parliament as he delivers his reaction to vote in House of Commons. He called for EU to remain 
calm, united, to continue dialogue and be transparent. He said it's now up to the UK to provide clarity

I take note with regret of the outcome of the vote in the @HouseofCommons this evening. I urge the #UK to clarify its intentions as soon as possible. Time is almost up #Brexit 

https://t.co/SMmps5kexn

The backstop preserves the single greatest British policy success of the last half century (which had been stated aim of both parties since 1985), and does so in a way that EU26 dislikes enough that it doesn’t stymie trade talks. In a sane world, it’s a diplomatic triumph.

Another, potentially very damaging British-German misunderstanding.

As a general principle, if the UK press reports a possible large concession by Merkel to the UK on #brexit, check the German media. UK press has almost always overblown German 'concessions' https://t.co/v6ipS6QNRz
My reply to @theresa_may, together with @eucopresident, providing clarifications to the #Brexit Withdrawal Agreement and Political Declaration. https://t.co/f0PalJkRVu

.@JunckerEU @ntvde #Brexit “We have negotiated a Withdrawal Agreement with the British government. This is our final offer. We can add clarifications but we will not renegotiate. The choice is: accept or reject it.” https://t.co/L4vtKpSNHn

@soledadobrien @politico Very annoying story. But again interesting that a woman did the job for @politico. I don’t know  @ewarren but I can smell the same patterns as in anti @HillaryClinton campaign even from Europe. As women in politics we have to stand against it because it is targeting us.
